title: Birth of the World Wide Web
summary: In 1991, Tim Berners-Lee launched the first website at CERN, introducing the World Wide Web to the world. This revolutionary system combined hypertext, networking, and a simple markup language to create an interconnected information space.
significance: The World Wide Web transformed the internet from a text-based system used primarily by academics and researchers into a global multimedia platform accessible to everyone. Berners-Lee's decision to make the technology freely available, without patents or royalties, enabled the explosive growth that followed. The web became the foundation for e-commerce, social media, and the modern digital economy.
keyFigures: Tim Berners-Lee - Inventor of the World Wide Web
Robert Cailliau - Collaborator and advocate for the project
